name: Hotel Accademia

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Accademia for one night in early March, 2005. We did not have a reservation and walked there from the train station. Using Rick Steves book, we chose this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised when the desk clerk said it would only be 80 euros, but then we were put in room #2 overlooking a busy street. We thought we could handle the street noise, but around midnight, the samba club directly across the street started picking up. Around 3:30 am, my husband and I got up to look out the window because the noise was getting louder and louder. There were probably 100 or more partiers in the street directly under our window. Music, sirens, singing...it never stopped. The next day we moved to the delightfully quiet Residenza Il Villino and then wasted our first day in Florence napping at our new hotel. The Hotel Accademia was not on the side of the tourist area I would have preferred to stay on - Florence is nicer closer to the river or north of the duomo. The bed was uncomfortable. Things were clean, but the bedding was old and we had a hard time trying to figure out how to turn off the light in the bathroom. The staff was very nice, however. Not the worst hotel ever, and if you had an interior room it might be okay, but I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Noisy - could not sleep at all!
Okay for the money...
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Accademia for 3 nights in mid November 2004. The room was decent, clean and relatively quiet. The bathroom was huge by Italy standards and very updated. The location was great, would stay here again.

reviews.title: Average for the price
reviews.text: Stayed at a variety of hotels in Italy, Germany and Switzerland, most within the 100-150 Euro range, and this was probably the least attractive for the price (140 Euro). Had a quiet, clean room in the inner part of the building, air conditioning worked well, and was centrally located to sights and the train station. However, the room was among the most plain-looking of those we stayed in, and the bathroom left something to be desired. It was the only in this price range in which one shared the shower with a toilet. The floor plan, as Rick Steves mentions, is boggling and a little annoying for the tired traveler. One nice touch: the staff pointed us to a small stash of guide books they loaned for free to help appreciate the local museums.

We stayed for 2 nights at the end of August, and I'm not entirely sure that I would reccommend this hotel to anyone...The hotel itself was really neat-an old palace/mansion w/ a crazy floor plan. We stayed in room #1-Rooms #1 and #2 are right by the front desk-EXTREMELY noisy at night. The sheets were super scratchy and actually gave my husband and I both rashes, and the toilet ran all night long-I kept trying to convince myself it was a beautiful stream in a meadow-but w/ the front desk noise combined w/ a little jet lag sleep was difficult. But you get what you pay for-we only paid 90 euro a night. The other good things: Nice location, decent breakfast, good A/C.
reviews.title: not so sure about this one...
Wonderful, small hotel
reviews.text: We spent 10 days at Hotel Accademia in late April-May. Excellent location, quiet at night,very clean,great bed and bathroom;good breakfast,taxes and service included plus the hotel owner and staff are very helpful and gracious. Several excellent restaurants within easy walking distance:Trattoria Antellesi (right outside entrance to hotel) on Via Faenza and Porcuspino-(porcupine) trattoria around the corner. One of Rick Steeves tour groups stayed there for a few days. We walked all over the city, took public bus to Fiesole for the day and the train to Pietra Santa-marble carving area., and also joined a tour group to Siena and San Gimigniano for a day. Easy walk to train station. Hotel staff can get reservations for you at Uffizi, so no waiting in lines. We would strongly recommend this hotel .....

reviews.title: Great hotel, great location
reviews.text: I stayed one night at the Accademia Hotel, on my own, before meeting friends in Florence and touring Tuscany. I followed the directions on the website from the SMN station and fund the hotel easily. The staff were all very friendly and my room was lovely. I paid 75 Euros for a single room but actually had a double bed which was great. Bathroom was fabulous and I had air-con as well, which was a bonus because it was stonkingly hot in Florence that day!

The hotel is up stairs and I was on the top floor with no lift, but that wasn't a problem for me. My room was very quiet with only the slamming of others doors to bother me (always take earplugs when sleeping in hotels lol!). The hotel is very well placed to wander around Florence but it's not in the 'best' parts of town but I felt perfectly safe wandering about in the late evening.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I would stay again if visiting Florence again.
reviews.title: Pleasurable experience
I would came back
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel as part of a tour in May 2006. It is in a great location for Florence, near the Central Market and walking distance to most of the main tourist sights. It is located next to the “Museum of Torture” but don’t let that deter you, it makes it easier to find. Many, many US college students in the area, giving it a somewhat surreal feeling you’ve not left home. On the plus side, Internet cafes all over the place. The rooms were very clean and pretty spacious (I was in a triple). Terribly noisy on garbage day because my room faced a street (others in the group had courtyard facing rooms and had no noise issues). Decent breakfast, although one morning the coffee was stone cold. There is a lovely internal courtyard to have a pre-dinner drink or just to relax.

We stayed at the Accademia for two nights, apparently special rate of 75 euros, which was nice after Rome prices. The hotel is within walking distance from the train station, and pretty much walking distance to everything else. Nice clean room, confusing hotel floor plan, good breakfast. Irish Pub a couple of doors up. We had no trouble with smells or noise. It was pretty cold in Florence in mid march. Hotel clerk turned us on to a great restaurant. I fell for the steak Florentine, which was a good steak, but just a char broiled porterhouse which you can get anywhere in the US. Not exactly the kind of food I went to Italy to experience. I would stay in this hotel again. Staff member ran out after us to give us an item of clothing that was left in room. A pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To say this hotel was supposed to be only two stars I think it truly surpassed itself!
reviews.title: Great location
Location, Location, Location
reviews.text: The hotel was a little hidden but the reception area was really pleasant. The hotel was spacious and laid out almost villa like which we thought was lovely. The room was much bigger than the one in Rome. The bed was large and comfortable. The room had very nice air-conditioning which was quiet enough to have on all night. The bathroom was a little strange as the sink, shower and toilet was separated. the shower was excellent and was in its own little room. the location was also excellent and very close to all the main sights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not have breakfast included, but the hotel was excellent, the staff friendly and helpful except at the end when we were told that we had to pay by cash very rudely. But everyone else seemed helpful and friendly. That was really the only issue we had, because they did not tell us we had to pay in cash and were a little rude about it.
reviews.title: the Accademia a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again and recommend it!
reviews.title: Hotel quality expected for Europe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Accademia as part of a Rick Steves tour. (LOVED the tour, but that is another review!) This hotel is centrally located to EVERYTHING. Not only the artistic sites, museums, and churches, but also restaurants and shops.
reviews.title: A good compromise
Great hotel!!
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in the Hotel Accademia in Florence, and we loved it there! Close to the station, lots of market stalls, and easy walking distance to everywhere else. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room clean and comfortable, the windows and shutters made the room very cool and quiet - we slept like logs. We would recommend this hotel and definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Smelly
reviews.text: Just returned from a fabulous trip to Italy but unfortunately the low point of the trip was the Hotel Accademia. The hotel seemed fine (room was ok, bathroom clean) but the sewer smell was overpowering. We thought maybe this was coming from the street but realized quickly that it was coming from the drains in the bathroom after we openned the door to the bathroom (the bathroom itself was clean, the smell was from the drains in the bathroom). Air conditioning was useless since it was impossible to be in the room without the windows open. Other areas of the hotel did not smell - it seemed to be only in the area around the room. Would suggest making sure the room does not smell before you consider a room here.

Well, we were actually assigned the largest, quietest suite in the hotel. It was great except the smell of smoke was overpowering. We were moved to the very noisy, room next to the back alley. We asked to be moved again and was shown 2 other choices. We picked the room off the lobby and were very happy with the choice. That all happened in the 1st 2 hours. The hotel was not crowded so we were lucky to be able to switch. We did ask for non-smoking and the room was designated non-smoking but I guess policies aren't enforced. The room was pretty standard, the shower sprays all over the bathroom floor, but it worked out fine. The hotel itself is in a great location. We walked everywhere. The train station is a 5 minute walk. The hotel clerk recommended the Za Za restaurant and it was really great. The breakfast was fine, same as the other 2 hotels we stayed in. All in all it was a good experience.
reviews.title: The front desk made an effort.

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night. Pretty hotel in a remodeled old old building. Next to the medieval torture museum (kids laughed about that). Well located for sightseeing. (We arrived late afternoon and still made it into the Uffizi.) Up a long staircase to desk; beautiful stained glass entry (which we were told is locked late at night). We had a quad room which was plainly but nicely painted and decorated and was also quite clean. Ok - the bad parts - the neighborhood gets a bit dicey after about 9 or 10pm and the street noise continues loud pretty late. I told the kids to pretend someone had left the TV on to an HBO special: Druggies and their Motor Scooters. Much laughter before we finally got to sleep (which we did albeit later than normal). Would I stay here again? - sure, but I'd try for an interior room.
reviews.title: Nice budget choice, but can be noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Accademia is a quaint hotel with a lot of character and was a great place to stay - once we moved from a room that faced the street to one that faced the interior! Our first night, we were awoken at 4:00 am by the noise of vendors setting up and supplying the local shops. The staff were helpful in setting us up with another room. The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms very nice and well-equipped. We visited in December and it was cold, and we found that by law they could only run the heat certain hours of the day - so by American standards it was a bit chilly. The staff were very helpful and reasonably fluent in English. The breakfast, included in the rate, was OK. The hotel is situated in a great area if you like to shop; a major clothing and tourist merchandise market is only a block away; it is also situated well for those who prefer exploring the art and architecture of Florence. We would stay there again - if we could book the quiet rooms.
reviews.title: Great experience!

likes.disliked: — Way too many steps with no elevator

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel recenty as part of a small tour, they also accomodated my extra nights. The hotel is in a great location. 5 minute walk from train station and just a few minutes away from most major sites. Just off the Piazza for the Medici Chapel.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was in the back and I packed a little heavier than I should have so did have to drag my luggage around. Each room is a little different. Mine was average size by European standards with a small bathroom. My shower was directly over the toilet but it was fine for a single person. Wouldn't want to share this kind of bathroom as drying off the toilet for the next person would be a pain. Other people in our group had larger rooms, and really nice bathrooms.
reviews.title: Good budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The window overlooked a small tiny courtyard, and while there wasn't much exterior light, it was nice and dark at night. I didn't have much outside noise. Yes, other windows are close, but I kept the exterior shutters closed and it wasn't a problem. Some of the folks in the front had street noise at night.
reviews.title: Ok Hotel - People were Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was fine. Pretty basic but more than adequate. Breakfast isn't a big meal in Italy so save yourself for lunch & dinner.
reviews.title: Good place, Great Location

description: Hotel Accademia - Florence, Italy.Your cheap accommodation in Florence historical center...We provide you the easiest way to reserve your vacation in Florence city center. The Hotel Accademia gives you an opportunity to choose a splendid and strategical location for your stay in Florence. Book online with us, save money with our special last minute offers and enjoy everything Florence has to offer! Welcome!
